class  Util::KillService
 Default implementation for Signal serviceThis class implements default behavior for signal handling :

  • exit the process on E_KILL
  • do nothing for all other signals.
More...
class  Util::ByteAllocator
 ByteAllocator of fixed size objects with cache for fast allocation (thread unsafe)A list registers freed blocks until a given theshold. Allocation tries to found a block in the list before using standard allocation. Deallocation puts a block in the list until list size is equal to threshold. At that time normal deallocation is done. We can define a new allocator of cells: More...

ex   ) 
Value:
if (!(cond)) {       \
       ::std::ostringstream str;\
       str << ex.what() << "\tFile:" << __FILE__ << ", Line:" << KAAPI_VALTOSTR(__LINE__);\
       Util::System_abort( str.str() );\
    }

Assertion which display message before calling System_abort if cond is failed.

Assertion which throw exception ex if cond is not equal to true.

Enumeration Type Documentation

anonymous enum

List of predefined signal number with associated value

Some POSIX signals are mapped to Kaapi event number. The correspondance is the following POSIX KAAPI --------------- SIGABRT E_ABRT SIGQUIT E_QUIT SIGINT E_INT SIGXCPU E_XCPU SIGUSR1 E_DUMP In case of delivery of other signal, the killservice will receive be notified of POSIX signal number through the value of the KAAPI associated to the event number E_POSIX.

Enumerator:
E_NOP 

No operation.

E_KILL 

Kill the process, cannot be catch <=> SIGKILL.

E_ABRT 

Abort the process <=> SIGABRT.

E_QUIT 

QUIT the process <=> SIGQUIT.

E_INT 

Interrup the process <=> SIGINT.

E_TERM 

Signal end of the computation, not SIGTERM.

E_XCPU 

<=> SIGXCPU

E_STOP 

Stop all activities for the process.

E_CONT 

Continue activities for the process.

E_DRWS 

Disable remote workstealing.

E_ERWS 

Enable remote workstealing.

E_FAIL 

Signal failed process gid='value' of the failed process.

E_CHKT 

Force checkpoint.

E_RSRT 

Force restart process with gid given by the value.

E_DUMP 

Force dump state of the process <=> SIGHUP. KaapiServer and KaapiChkServer reify this signal.

E_JOIN 

New process gid='value' is joining the group.

E_LEAVE 

Process gid='value' leaving the group.

E_BWAIT 

The Core::Thread is begin to wait.

E_EWAIT 

The Core::Thread is end to wait and begin to continue.

E_POSIX 

Value is the posix signal number.

E_CHSS 

Change work stealing strategy to the one given by 'value'.

E_SHLIB 

Load a shared library component, value: 1 load, 2 unload, string param is the pathname of the library.

E_STEAL 

A workset, a processor, a thread receive a steal signal to export work.

E_NFREE 

Next signal number free for the user.
